ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: How to think critically about visual communication, how to be more intentional with every tool/tactic I utilize to convey a message
I learned how to think for myself and think for others. This was a great introduction to viewing graphic design as the study of modes of communication and representation.

I developed a sense of spatial arrangement and an increased sensitivity to my visual surroundings. The Intro to Graphic Design course will challenge you to develop your own design sense and through different methods understand the basic components of good design.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I appreciate the honestly of critiques and the challenge that Yeju presents. I felt as though she holds her student to a high standard, which I personally found incredibly enriching. There could be slightly more consideration for our schedules as undergraduates (due date conflicting with breaks and major events)

The course gradually increased in difficulty and the skills learned were definitely taught in the right order. I wish we would of had more time to use the skills we learned at the end of the class on more projects or just more exercises.
Too much time was spent on critiques. There should have been more interactive work/activities/lessons in class time.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! Really important skill to be able to communicate visually and also understand visual communication comprehensively (even if you never plan to be a graphic designer or make art in anyway)
Yes, I loved it so much.

I highly recommend this course for anyone interested in an introduction to visual thinking and design. Yeju Choi is a brilliant artist and designer, and her guidance/critique helped me learn how to see my environment in new ways. This class rocks, take it!
